attributes.action: Re-instate the deathe penalty after 3 high court judges cannot find the condemd person innocent.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We petition the Prime Minsiter and the elected members of council to re-instate the death penalty after the following crimes have been proven guilty:

Murder in the first and second degree (American interpretation accepted) and 
Sexual Abuse - of a minor.

However, to avoid the risk of innocent hangings, a person found guilty by 12 must have their case reviewed by no less that 3 high court judges (who's job it is to find them guilty but not of a death penalty) i.e. find doubt in the case presented, if they cannot find doubt in the case and it is 100% bomb proof then this case should then be passed to the home secretary who has the ultimate veto, if he can find no reason to spare the individual then the death sentance should be passed and be carried out within 28 days.  In essence, bring back the death penalty for individuals who are convicted with out doubt 100% of the aforementioned crimes

rejection.details: There is a similar petition at: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/DeathPenalty2007/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
